verses.verse: After <S%H310><s%> this <S%H3651><s%> opened <S%H6605><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> <S%H853><s%> his mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and cursed <S%H7043><s%> <S%H853><s%> his day. <S%H3117><s%>
And Job <S%H347><s%> spoke, <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>

Let the day <S%H3117><s%> perish <S%H6><s%> wherein I was born, <S%H3205><s%> and the night <S%H3915><s%> in which it was said, <S%H559><s%> There is a man child <S%H1397><s%> conceived. <S%H2029><s%>

Let that <S%H1931><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> darkness; <S%H2822><s%> let not <S%H408><s%> God <S%H433><s%> regard <S%H1875><s%> it from above, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4605><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> let the light <S%H5105><s%> shine <S%H3313><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> it.

Let darkness <S%H2822><s%> and the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%> stain <S%H1350><s%> it; let a cloud <S%H6053><s%> dwell <S%H7931><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> it; let the blackness <S%H3650><s%> of the day <S%H3117><s%> terrify <S%H1204><s%> it.

As for that <S%H1931><s%> night, <S%H3915><s%> let darkness <S%H652><s%> seize upon <S%H3947><s%> it; let it not <S%H408><s%> be joined <S%H2302><s%> unto the days <S%H3117><s%> of the year, <S%H8141><s%> let it not <S%H408><s%> come <S%H935><s%> into the number <S%H4557><s%> of the months. <S%H3391><s%>
Lo, <S%H2009><s%> let that <S%H1931><s%> night <S%H3915><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> solitary, <S%H1565><s%> let no <S%H408><s%> joyful voice <S%H7445><s%> come <S%H935><s%> therein.
Let them curse <S%H5344><s%> it that curse <S%H779><s%> the day, <S%H3117><s%> who are ready <S%H6264><s%> to raise up <S%H5782><s%> their mourning. <S%H3882><s%>

Let the stars <S%H3556><s%> of the twilight <S%H5399><s%> thereof be dark; <S%H2821><s%> let it look <S%H6960><s%> for light, <S%H216><s%> but have none; <S%H369><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> let it see <S%H7200><s%> the dawning <S%H6079><s%> of the day: <S%H7837><s%>

Because <S%H3588><s%> it shut not up <S%H3808><s%> <S%H5462><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of my mother's womb, <S%H990><s%> nor hid <S%H5641><s%> sorrow <S%H5999><s%> from mine eyes. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5869><s%>

Why <S%H4100><s%> died <S%H4191><s%> I not <S%H3808><s%> from the womb? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7358><s%> why did I not give up the ghost <S%H1478><s%> when I came out <S%H3318><s%> of the belly? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H990><s%>
Why <S%H4069><s%> did the knees <S%H1290><s%> prevent <S%H6923><s%> me? or why <S%H4100><s%> the breasts <S%H7699><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> I should suck? <S%H3243><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> should I have lain still <S%H7901><s%> and been quiet, <S%H8252><s%> I should have slept: <S%H3462><s%> then <S%H227><s%> had I been at rest, <S%H5117><s%>
With <S%H5973><s%> kings <S%H4428><s%> and counselors <S%H3289><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> which built <S%H1129><s%> desolate places <S%H2723><s%> for themselves;
Or <S%H176><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> princes <S%H8269><s%> that had gold, <S%H2091><s%> who filled <S%H4390><s%> their houses <S%H1004><s%> with silver: <S%H3701><s%>

Or <S%H176><s%> as a hidden <S%H2934><s%> untimely birth <S%H5309><s%> I had not <S%H3808><s%> been; <S%H1961><s%> as infants <S%H5768><s%> which never <S%H3808><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> light. <S%H216><s%>
There <S%H8033><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> cease <S%H2308><s%> from troubling; <S%H7267><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> the weary <S%H3019><s%> <S%H3581><s%> be at rest. <S%H5117><s%>
There the prisoners <S%H615><s%> rest <S%H7599><s%> together; <S%H3162><s%> they hear <S%H8085><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the oppressor. <S%H5065><s%>
The small <S%H6996><s%> and great <S%H1419><s%> are there; <S%H8033><s%> and the servant <S%H5650><s%> is free <S%H2670><s%> from his master. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H113><s%>
Wherefore <S%H4100><s%> is light <S%H216><s%> given <S%H5414><s%> to him that is in misery, <S%H6001><s%> and life <S%H2416><s%> unto the bitter <S%H4751><s%> in soul; <S%H5315><s%>
Which long <S%H2442><s%> for death, <S%H4194><s%> but it cometh not; <S%H369><s%> and dig <S%H2658><s%> for it more than for hid treasures; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4301><s%>
Which rejoice <S%H8056><s%> exceedingly, <S%H413><s%> <S%H1524><s%> and are glad, <S%H7797><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> they can find <S%H4672><s%> the grave? <S%H6913><s%>
Why is light given to a man <S%H1397><s%> whose <S%H834><s%> way <S%H1870><s%> is hid, <S%H5641><s%> and whom <S%H1157><s%> God <S%H433><s%> hath hedged in? <S%H5526><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> my sighing <S%H585><s%> cometh <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> I eat, <S%H3899><s%> and my roarings <S%H7581><s%> are poured out <S%H5413><s%> like the waters. <S%H4325><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> the thing which I greatly feared <S%H6343><s%> <S%H6342><s%> is come upon <S%H857><s%> me, and that which <S%H834><s%> I was afraid of <S%H3025><s%> is come <S%H935><s%> unto me.
I was not <S%H3808><s%> in safety, <S%H7951><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> had I rest, <S%H8252><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> was I quiet; <S%H5117><s%> yet trouble <S%H7267><s%> came. <S%H935><s%>
